intro: Calochilus campestris var. grandiflorus, commonly known as the large-flowered grass orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to Australia. It features slender, grass-like leaves and produces showy, violet or purple flowers with a distinctive spurred lip. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in open habitats. It is known for its delicate appearance and is often found in coastal or inland regions. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some areas.
